alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 6:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 602 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Fleming-Neon, Colly, Ermine, Mayking, Sergent, Eolia, Winters, Oven Fork, Thornton, Wright, Millstone, Dongola, Day, Seco, Whitaker, Neon Junction, Chip, Tolliver Town and Cromona.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
